column5: I am looking for a boat cover for my 16 ft MR Pike Lund, does anyone know of a shop that custom makes them ? I see them on the net from Iboats, and other sites for around 200 us plus shipping, not sure if that is a good deal, seems ok, am in the gta,any help would be appreciated Thanks Al

Omar Marine Sales in Barrie does boat covers(705-733-2681). I paid $700 for the cover on my LUND 1775 ProV SE. I use it for trailering, plus I have a cheaper(less than $200) cover from Princess Auto that I use while my boat is in my driveway.  Princess Auto carries 2 different makes of boat covers. They say they are trailerable, but I wouldn't trailer with them. Crappy Tire also carries boat covers, I forget the price(approx $200). If you are going to get a custom cover, make sure you get a good grade of canvas.
i got a custom cover made up for me in the thornhill area. it turned out great and they did it in just a few days. if you want the info just send me over a PM.

if you can afford it, there's no substitute for a custom cover, I think you'd be disappointed with the universal ones.  A good one will probably cost between $500-$800.  Have you priced them from Lund?  I have one on my 17ft Pro Angler and it's excellent.
I got my custom cover made at Falle Marnie systems, but it's up near Huntsville.  They did a great job and i had my boat back in under a week.  It cost me $600.00
Covers Unlimited in Brampton, paid mine around $450 and it was done in a day!!!
thanks peps i called him..yikes  $650. is what he told me
Greg at Covers Unlimited does a fantastic job and like Peps mentioned, it will be done in a day! If he quoted you $650.00, I would think that will be the best you do for a custom made cover.
sounds good, i will prob make a deal with him. i am off next week so i can drop it out there and get it the next day or so.. thanks for the help
